Pre-Game Insights: England recorded one of the most famous victories in the history of the sport four years ago, winning the World Cup on boundary count after the 50 over match and Super Over that followed were both tied.
England currently hold both the menâ€™s ODI and T20 World titles, a feat that no other team in history has achieved.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The defending champions enter this fixture as favourites.

England, on the other hand, enter the fixture with a full bill of health and all six of their seam bowlers to choose from, presenting head coach Matthew Mott with the only real selection dilemma entering the first match.
Kane Williamson, who continues to recover from a knee injury, and their lead bowler Tim Southee is also a doubt having undergone surgery on a fractured thumb.
Others: The match will start at 9:30am UK time and can be watched on Sky Sports Cricket and Main Event from 9am.
Sky Sports customers can live stream the match via the Sky Go app on a variety of devices including most smartphones and tablets as part of their subscription.
